conclusion: Determine the dynamic friction factor between the ground and the logs using static friction and conservation of energy.
Maximum static friction force F_max is determined using the formula F_max = μN.
Normal force N is equal to the weight of the logs, N = mg.
Angle θ between the normal force and the direction of motion is calculated using tan(θ) = 1/2, θ = arctan(1/2) ≈ 16.3°.
Maximum static friction force is calculated as F_max = μmg.
Maximum dynamic friction force F_max is equal to the maximum static friction force, F_max = μmg.
Dynamic friction factor μ is calculated as μ = F_max/N, resulting in μ = μ.
Dynamic friction factor between the ground and the logs is μ = 1.
